comments:
eclipse 3.2 and TPTP 4.2.0
Running TPTP JUnit Plugin test.
Created the testsuite file, workbench location file, and the deployment correctly.

When I run test remotely, the test progress bar first stays at 60% for about a minute and then suddenly closes without any message or warning. I checked the .metadata/.log file to find this exeption. 

org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.InactiveProcessException
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarnessExecutorStub.launch(TestExecutionHarnessExecutorStub.java:420)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.launchTestExecution(TestExecutionHarness.java:2085)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.access$3(TestExecutionHarness.java:1817)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness$2.run(TestExecutionHarness.java:741)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


Earlier I got this problem when runnning the tests on my local machine (using a stand-alone agent controller). I stopped the workbench and the agent controller and deleted /tmp/IBMRAC/ramaster file. After this the problem was solved.

But for remote test on a different machine:-
- I tried clearing up the /tmp/IBMRAC/ramaster file on both machines.
- Installed TPTP on the remote workbench

Also, the agent controller has been configured properly with correct PATH, JAVA_HOME and LD_LIBRARY_PATH set. I can even connect to the agent. The agent spawns a java process(mentioned with details below) and deploys a workspace at /tmp/<user>

The java process that runs on the remote machine is:-
<java_bin_path>/java -Dhyades.test.JVM="<java_bin_path>/java" org.eclipse.hyades.execution.remote.NodeImpl 9803543

Prince,
Do you have the log produced the remote eclipse instance? It is either in the remote configuration directory (should be something like /tmp/<user>/tptp-configuration-xxx/ if you kept the defaults) if eclipse failed early, or in your workspace metadata directory(something like /tmp/<user>/tptp-workspace-xxx/.metadata/).
If you have it, can you attach it to this bugzilla or send it to me by email. Thanks.

Created an attachment (id=47065)
log from the remote eclipse's /tmp/<user>/tptp-configuration-<pluginname>/

Hi Julien,

I'm attaching the required log file.

Prince Singh
Drishti Soft Solutions

Thanks,
It looks like TPTP is not correctly recognized on your remote eclipse. The test fails because eclipse can't find the plugin "org.eclipse.hyades.test.tools.core". This is either because this plugin is not installed, or one of its pre-requisites is missing (for instance, EMF).
Another explanation could be that you installed TPTP after having launched eclipse once. In this case you need to run the remote eclipse with the -clean option on the command line, so eclipse may rescan the plugins directory, and find TPTP plugins.

The better way to fix the problem is to make sure that TPTP is working on the remote eclipse first, launched in standalone mode. Can you launch the remote eclipse instance, and check that TPTP plugins are available? (One simple verification is to see if the "Test" category is available in the "New..." wizard). If TPTP is not available, could you 1) check that all pre-requisistes are installed (EMF) and 2) try launching eclipse with -clean on the command line.
If TPTP is working on the remote eclipse launched standalone, and you still have problems with launching remote tests, then let me know.

Hi Julien,

I had already seen the log and thought that to be the problem. To confirm I tried to run the TPTP junit plugin test on the remote machine from its eclispe workbech only. Standalone Agent controller also at the machine. I could do it successfully. No errors or failures or log output.

TPTP is also installed correctly:-
1. I've Test category in New > Other
2. I can see the "org.eclipse.hyades.test.tools.core" in About > Plugins
3. I can see the "org.eclipse.hyades.test.tools.core" in Plugins-Registry(Show View > PDE Runtime)

I've also run eclipse using 'eclipse -clean'
If you require more input then I can provide

Prince Singh
Drishti Soft Solutions

Prince Singh
Drishti Soft Solutions

Thanks Prince,

1) On which platform the local eclipse (as opposed to remote) is running?
2) Are the local eclipse's target plaform (the one defined in Preferences > Plug-in Development > Target Platform > Location) and the remote eclipse identical (i.e. same plugins, same versions)?

Hi Julien,

> I have been delayed by some testing tasks on the 4.2.1 candidate build, but now

No problem !

> I'm trying to reproduce the problem. Can you tell me:
> 1) On which platform the local eclipse (as opposed to remote) is running?

Linux on both local as well as remote. 

> 2) Are the local eclipse's target plaform (the one defined in Preferences >
> Plug-in Development > Target Platform > Location) and the remote eclipse
> identical (i.e. same plugins, same versions)?

Now that may be the problem. On the remote platform I do not have all the plugins that are enabled on the Target Platform page of the local eclipse. Though I have all the required plugins for my plugin on the remote platform(I can run the test locally there). What could be the possible way to select only the plugins required by my plugin from the Target Platform sheet.

Also, the Location text box on the local eclipse is not the same as the remote one.
>

(In reply to comment #6)

> Now that may be the problem. On the remote platform I do not have all the
> plugins that are enabled on the Target Platform page of the local eclipse.
> Though I have all the required plugins for my plugin on the remote platform(I
> can run the test locally there). What could be the possible way to select only
> the plugins required by my plugin from the Target Platform sheet.

That's likely to be the problem. In the current version, TPTP does not check that the remote platform has all the plugins available. The list of plugins to activate can be edited in the workbench location editor (in the "Eclipse Workbench Properties" tab > "Choose plug-ins to launch from the list").
You need to uncheck in this list all the plug-ins that are not installed on your remote eclipse. Also, you need to make sure that the versions of the plug-ins shown in this list match the versions of the plug-ins on the remote machine (the versions need to be *completely* identical).
> 
> Also, the Location text box on the local eclipse is not the same as the remote
> one.
If you mean the "Eclipse location" text box, this field must contain the path of the eclipse directory on the remote machine.
I have filed bugzilla https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=152327 to get a better diagnostic when remote eclipse fails to launch.
